abstract: Gretchen Morgenson Fair Game column examines document filed in 2013 shareholder lawsuit against directors of Dish Network that shows hazard of having friends of chief executive on corporate board, which is all too common in publicly owned companies; notes that issue in suit was chief executive Charles W Ergen's purchase of distressed debt in troubled company LightSquared.
lead_paragraph: The shareholders’ lawsuit contends that a board that included members with personal and family connections to the company’s chief did not act in their best interests.

headline.main: Dish Suit Shows Close Ties Between Executive and Board Members
headline.print_headline: Dish’s Chief, and Buddies on the Board
